title: A lot of tests can fail on a run with Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
description:
Build: http://jenkins.thetaphi.de/job/Lucene-Solr-trunk-Linux/15259/

Usually says:


Caused by: org.apache.http.client.NonRepeatableRequestException: Cannot retry request with a non-repeatable request entity.  The cause lists the reason the original request failed.

 Looks like mostly example jetty tests. Something in common there.

Usually, but not always, in deleteByQuery in the test.

comments.author: Shalin Shekhar Mangar
comments.content: I think this is a result of the Jetty 9.3 upgrade in SOLR-7339. There is one reproducible failure in SolrExampleStreaming*Test.testUpdateField which I have disabled for now. I've been trying to get to the root cause but I'm not making much progress. Any help would be appreciated since you were digging into stale connections and connection reset issues at one point.

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.content:
It always seems to be the first request to jetty that fails. The failures also seem to happen in groups, which is interesting. The first request thing would indicate either we have not fully started yet, or we were not able to start properly.

One scatter guess is perhaps we are now able to return from jetty.start too early?

Perhaps in JettySolrRunner we should try waiting on start until lifecycle#started, rather than lifecycle#starting.

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.content:
I've started looking at SOLR-8411.

SOLR-8411 looks like a Locale bug - probably in Jetty, perhaps in Restlet. That's not good, because now some things are broken in some Local(s).

It has the same symptoms as this issue - first request to Jetty gets a connection reset. In it's case, it looks like that happens because our Restlet Application fails to be setup properly at it's end point.

This issue also may be some similar failure to set something up, but it doesn't appear repeatable by seed and does not appear to be dependent on Locale.

comments.author: Erick Erickson
comments.content:
I may have a related reproducible failure case that I think is related to the Jetty upgrade.

I was looking at SOLR-6971 and have a series of 100% reproducible failures and at least the first one fails in the debugger when running TestRebalanceLeaders. These do not fail on 5x, so I'm guessing they may be related to the Jetty upgrade (Thanks Ishan for reminding me!). I think that the only required bit is the seed, or at least removing locale, timezone and encoding didn't seem to matter.

I did notice that it looks like all the Solr instances I try to start up are killed by ChaosMonkey. This may be a total red herring though, my knowledge of ChaosMonkey is limited at best.
